Content:: José Guadalupe Galván Galindo (21 August 1941 – 16 July 2022) was a Mexican Roman Catholic prelate. Galván Galindo was born in Mexico and was ordained to the priesthood in 1965. He served as bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Ciudad Valles, Mexico from 1994 to 2000 and as bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Torreón, Mexico from 2000 until his retirement in 2017.[1]  This article about a Catholic bishop is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
